text.section: The Comptroller, the Chief Deputy Comptroller, or a deputy comptroller may not sign a blank warrant.

A warrant for payment of a bill is not valid unless the following information appears on the face of the warrant:
the amount of the warrant;
the date of issue;
a reference to the document that identifies:
the payee; and
the officer or unit of the State government that submitted the bill; and
the certification of the Comptroller, the Chief Deputy Comptroller, or a deputy comptroller that:
the amount of the warrant is correct; and
the officer or unit submitted the bill for which the warrant is issued.
